verses.verse: The words <WH1697> of king <WH4428> Lemuel, <WH3927> the prophecy <WH4853> that his mother <WH517> taught <WH3256> him.
What, <WH4100> my son? <WH1248> and what, <WH4100> the son <WH1248> of my womb? <WH990> and what, <WH4100> the son <WH1248> of my vows? <WH5088>
Give <WH5414> not your strength <WH2428> to women, <WH802> nor your ways <WH1870> to that which destroys <WH4229> kings. <WH4428>
It is not for kings, <WH4428> O Lemuel, <WH3927> it is not for kings <WH4428> to drink <WH8354> wine; <WH3196> nor <WH408> for princes <WH7336> strong drink: <WH7941>
Lest <WH6435> they drink, <WH8354> and forget <WH7911> the law, <WH2710> and pervert <WH8138> the judgment <WH1779> of any <WH3605> of the afflicted. <WH6040>
Give <WH5414> strong drink <WH7941> to him that is ready <WH4131> to perish, <WH6> and wine <WH3196> to those that be of heavy <WH4751> hearts. <WH5315>
Let him drink, <WH8354> and forget <WH7911> his poverty, <WH7389> and remember <WH2142> his misery <WH5999> no <WH3808> more. <WH5750>
Open <WH6605> your mouth <WH6310> for the dumb <WH483> in the cause <WH1779> of all <WH3605> such as are appointed <WH1121> to destruction. <WH2475>
Open <WH6605> your mouth, <WH6310> judge <WH8199> righteously, <WH6664> and plead <WH1777> the cause of the poor <WH6041> and needy. <WH34>
Who <WH4310> can find <WH4672> a virtuous <WH2428> woman? <WH802> for her price <WH4377> is far <WH7350> above rubies. <WH6443>
The heart <WH3820> of her husband <WH1167> does safely trust <WH982> in her, so that he shall have no <WH3808> need <WH2637> of spoil. <WH7998>
She will do <WH1580> him good <WH2896> and not evil <WH7451> all <WH3605> the days <WH3117> of her life. <WH2416>
She seeks <WH1875> wool, <WH6785> and flax, <WH6593> and works <WH6213> willingly <WH2656> with her hands. <WH3709>
She is like the merchants' <WH5503> ships; <WH591> she brings <WH935> her food <WH3899> from afar. <WH4801>
She rises <WH6965> also while it is yet <WH5750> night, <WH3915> and gives <WH5414> meat <WH2964> to her household, <WH1004> and a portion <WH2706> to her maidens. <WH5291>
She considers <WH2161> a field, <WH7704> and buys <WH3947> it: with the fruit <WH6529> of her hands <WH3709> she plants <WH5195> a vineyard. <WH3754>
She girds <WH2296> her loins <WH4975> with strength, <WH5797> and strengthens <WH553> her arms. <WH2220>
She perceives <WH2938> that her merchandise <WH5504> is good: <WH2896> her candle <WH5216> goes <WH3518> not out by night. <WH3915>
She lays <WH7971> her hands <WH3027> to the spindle, <WH3601> and her hands <WH3709> hold <WH8551> the distaff. <WH6418>
She stretches <WH6566> out her hand <WH3709> to the poor; <WH6041> yes, she reaches <WH7971> forth <WH6566> her hands <WH3027> to the needy. <WH34>
She is not afraid <WH3372> of the snow <WH7950> for her household: <WH1004> for all <WH3605> her household <WH1004> are clothed <WH3847> with scarlet. <WH8144>
She makes <WH6213> herself coverings <WH4765> of tapestry; her clothing <WH3830> is silk <WH8336> and purple. <WH713>
Her husband <WH1167> is known <WH3045> in the gates, <WH8179> when he sits <WH3427> among <WH5973> the elders <WH2205> of the land. <WH776>
She makes <WH6213> fine linen, <WH5466> and sells <WH4376> it; and delivers <WH5414> girdles <WH2290> to the merchant. <WH5503>
Strength <WH5797> and honor <WH1926> are her clothing; <WH3830> and she shall rejoice <WH7832> in time <WH3117> to come. <WH314>
She opens <WH6605> her mouth <WH6310> with wisdom; <WH2451> and in her tongue <WH3956> is the law <WH8451> of kindness. <WH2617>
She looks <WH6822> well <WH6822> to the ways <WH1979> of her household, <WH1004> and eats <WH398> not the bread <WH3899> of idleness. <WH6104>
Her children <WH1121> arise <WH6965> up, and call <WH833> her blessed; <WH833> her husband <WH1167> also, and he praises <WH1984> her.
Many <WH7227> daughters <WH1323> have done <WH6213> virtuously, <WH2428> but you excel <WH5927> them all. <WH3605>
Favor <WH2580> is deceitful, <WH8267> and beauty <WH3308> is vain: <WH1892> but a woman <WH802> that fears <WH3373> the LORD, <WH3068> she shall be praised. <WH1984>
Give <WH5414> her of the fruit <WH6529> of her hands; <WH3027> and let her own works <WH4639> praise <WH1984> her in the gates. <WH8179>
